Node.definition: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= individual or group of people especially selected and appointed for a certain purpose

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= practices that conform to the laws of God

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
literally: to bring out; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause an event to start taking place
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words
= referent to the location outside of an object

= a tall grass with stiff, sharply pointed leaves and a plume like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility
= a strip of cotton that, when placed in a lamp, draws up the oil on one side and is set alight on the other
literally: weakened; hence: = state in which a condition or process has lost its intensity
= causative process by which humans or deities cause a fire to come to an end, either in a natural way or by force
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
literally: to bring out; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause an event to start taking place
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= process by which humans gradually lose strength and energy after a prolonged time of activity
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
literally: to stretch out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities causes an area to be covered with something with the shape and the flexibility of a large piece of cloth
= causative action by which a deity creates the firmament to cover the earth as a vault, ◄ described as a craftsman who hammers out a piece of metal into a flat surface

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= object which derives from or comes from another object, used for plants and, by extension, for humans

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to seize|to hold|to take hold|to grasp|to handle
Node.definition: = action by which humans take hold of other humans or objects with their hands; the agent role is often extended figuratively to include objects, deities and certain conditions
literally: (one's) hand is with (someone else); hence: = action by with humans or deities offer assistance to (other) humans

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
literally: to open (someone else's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which deities give humans the ability to see things that they were not able to see before

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= place where criminals or other prisoners were confined
usually used as collective: = person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= place where criminals or other prisoners were confined
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= process by which a certain condition becomes a reality, ◄ as a new shoot that comes up from the ground

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= a certain quantity that fill a certain container
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
literally: to lift up (one's) voice = action by which humans speak with a loud voice
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= collection of dwellings, not surrounded by a wall
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= ethnic group consisting of Arab (עַרְבִי) nomads or Bedouin, known as warriors and sheep herders; ◄ descendants of Kedar
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= to cry out loud ◄ caused either by joy or by grief ► in order to give vent to one's feelings
literally: to put glory; hence: = causative action by which humans express their respect for a deity with words and actions
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

Node.gloss: to rouse|to stir up|to raise|to stoke
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes an event to start taking place, ◄ as if it had been dormant or inactive for a certain time

= process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= action by which warriors cry with a loud voice, ► trying to intimidate their opponents
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

literally: to make oneself strong; hence: = action by which humans or deities present themselves with boldness to other humans and deities, ≈ which may be good or bad depending on whether this boldness is justified
= action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions
= to restrain oneself from showing emotions
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

Node.gloss: to scream|to cry out|to groan|to moan
Node.definition: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = action by which humans make inarticulate sounds, ◄ caused by deep emotion that has been kept in check too long, ≈ and associated with the sounds produced by a woman in labor
= process by which humans or animals strain for breath with an open mouth, ◄ caused by exhaustion or pain
= state in which multiple events are connected

Node.gloss: to make dry|to cause to dry up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a state of dryness; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence are caused to lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= flowing body of water
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
= small body of stagnant water, usually in swampy area; ≈ seen as a blessing when contrasted with the desert, but as a curse when contrasted with a developed area
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence are caused to lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= causative action by which humans or deities give instructions to (other) humans with respect to a certain aspect of life, ◄ as if they take them by the hand and lead them along the way
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= a place where there is little or no light, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= an area of fairly level, high ground; ≈ sometimes associated with a lack of obstacles, both literally and figuratively
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= action by which humans or deities suspend their commitment to a certain pattern of behavior

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which humans or animals are unable to perceive with the ears
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see
= set of particles marking an object or event as a subset of a larger group which has been singled out from among the rest

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= state in which humans or animals are unable to perceive with the ears
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
literally: to open (one's) ears; hence: = action by which humans make an effort to hear
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= causative process by which a deity causes events to increase in intensity
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: to make great|to make important|to make glorious
Node.definition: = to cause an event to inspire awe and respect
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
= empty, open place ◄ in a solid body

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= place where criminals or other prisoners were confined

= causative action by which humans cause someone else to go to a location where that person will not be readily seen by others, ► in order to keep that person out of danger or to remove him/her from public life
= all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to cause to return (to someone); hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to regain control over something

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= referent to a time that is yet to come

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war|marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= state in which someone is willing to do something
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
literally: to pout our (one's) anger; hence: = action by which deities give full vent to their anger by punishing the offender
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= process by which an event is being performed with intensity and power
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: to burn; hence: = process by which events such as evil and anger happen with intensity and with consequences, as if it were fire

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put in/to/on (one's) heart; hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
